metadata.dc:author: López Hernández, F
Casas Fernández, C
Martínez-Lage, J
metadata.dc:description: We report the case of a 4-year-old girl who presented spontaneous watery discharge through the left nostril due to a basal encephalocele. Two infrequent operative findings were the presence of an excavation of the cribriform plate, and not of a true osseous defect, and the absence of the left olfactory bulb.
metadata.dc:title: Rinorrea espontánea por encefalocele basal.
[Spontaneous rhinorrhea due to basal encephalocele].
